# Recipe: Oven Roasted Brussels Sprouts

## Introduction
Oven roasted Brussels sprouts are a delicious and nutritious side dish that can be enjoyed on their own or paired with various main courses. This recipe brings out the natural sweetness of Brussels sprouts while adding a crispy texture. Brussels sprouts are packed with vitamins, minerals, and fiber, making them a healthy addition to any meal.

## Ingredients
- 1 pound Brussels sprouts
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper

## Equipment
- Baking sheet
- Mixing bowl
- Knife
- Cutting board

## Preparation Time
- 10 minutes

## Cooking Time
- 25 minutes

## Steps
1. Preheat the oven to 425째F (220째C).
2. Rinse the Brussels sprouts under cold water and pat them dry with a paper towel.
3. Trim the ends of the Brussels sprouts and remove any discolored outer leaves.
4. Cut the Brussels sprouts in half lengthwise.
5. In a mixing bowl, toss the halved Brussels sprouts with olive oil, salt, and black pepper until they are well coated.
6. Spread the Brussels sprouts evenly on a baking sheet, making sure they are in a single layer.
7. Place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and roast for 20-25 minutes, or until the Brussels sprouts are tender and golden brown, stirring once halfway through.
8. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the Brussels sprouts cool for a few minutes before serving.

## Serving Suggestions
- Oven roasted Brussels sprouts can be served as a side dish with roasted chicken, grilled steak, or baked salmon.
- They can also be added to salads or grain bowls for extra flavor and texture.
- Drizzle with balsamic glaze or sprinkle with Parmesan cheese for added richness.

## Variations
- Add minced garlic or chopped bacon to the Brussels sprouts before roasting for additional flavor.
- Toss the roasted Brussels sprouts with a squeeze of lemon juice or sprinkle with red pepper flakes for a tangy or spicy kick.
- For a sweeter twist, drizzle the roasted Brussels sprouts with honey or maple syrup before serving.

## Tips and Tricks
- Choose Brussels sprouts that are firm and bright green, without any yellow or wilted leaves.
- Make sure to cut the Brussels sprouts in half lengthwise for even cooking.
- To achieve maximum crispiness, avoid overcrowding the baking sheet. Use two sheets if necessary.
- For extra caramelization, roast the Brussels sprouts cut-side down.
- Adjust the seasoning according to your taste preferences. Add more salt or pepper if desired.

## Storage and Leftovers
- Store any leftover oven roasted Brussels sprouts in an airtight container in the refrigerator.
- They will remain fresh for up to 3 days.
- To reheat, place the Brussels sprouts in a preheated oven at 350째F (175째C) for about 10 minutes or until heated through.

## Frequently Asked Questions
- Can I use frozen Brussels sprouts for this recipe?
  - While fresh Brussels sprouts are recommended for the best texture and flavor, you can use frozen Brussels sprouts in a pinch. Just make sure to thaw and pat them dry before roasting.
- How can I make this recipe vegan?
  - This recipe is already vegan as it is. However, you can customize it by adding vegan-friendly toppings such as nutritional yeast or vegan cheese.
- Can I use other types of oil instead of olive oil?
  - Yes, you can use other oils such as avocado oil or coconut oil. Keep in mind that different oils may slightly alter the taste.
- Can I roast Brussels sprouts with other vegetables?
  - Absolutely! Roasting Brussels sprouts with other vegetables like carrots, sweet potatoes, or butternut squash can create a delicious and colorful medley. Just make sure to adjust the cooking time accordingly.
